alert.note: Alert for Chippewa (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued December 15 at 8:49PM CST until December 15 at 10:00PM CST by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM CST FOR SOUTHEASTERN DUNN...SOUTHERN CHIPPEWA AND EAU CLAIRE COUNTIES... At 848 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 5 miles northwest of Elk Mound to near Strum to 9 miles west of Black River Falls, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Augusta, Fall Creek, Bloomer and Boyd. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CST for west central Wisconsin. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
